TextBlock.Text: MALLOW: My love, have you seen the shuttle flying to Giant's Deep repeatedly? Whatever could be happening to compel so many flight attempts?
AVENS: It appears they are attempting to land on the north pole of the planet... Could it be some younglings beginning their quantum pilgrimage?
AVENS: How strange. It should not be that hard to calculate a shuttle trajectory to the north pole, should it?
MALLOW: OH. I remember now! It's that awful landing pad on the northern island that tests younglings on pinpoint-accurate shuttle calculations!
AVENS: What? I was only taught it was a mechanism of some kind to conserve on power.. I only recall mustering my courage to ask you if we could take the shuttle to Giant's Deep together that day..
MALLOW: The shuttle has to land on the <color=orange>landing pad</color> in order to power the tractor beam to ascend the tower. Otherwise, there's no way to enter the tower.

MALLOW: And I recall you accidentally recalling the shuttle back to the gravity cannon, after I landed us perfectly on the landing pad... Oh, you were fortunate I didn't calculate a shuttle trajectory into the sun for us afterwards.
